alert.note: Alert for Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 5:12AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rogers, eastern Osage, Washington, Nowata, southeastern Pawnee and northeastern Tulsa Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 512 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Hulah to 3 miles west of Ochelata to 6 miles east of Walnut Creek State Park. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Bartlesville... Sand Springs... Claremore... Nowata... Pawhuska... Owasso... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Dewey... Barnsdall... Sperry... Oologah... South Coffeyville... Copan... Ramona... Wynona... Ochelata... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 237 and 251. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington
